plan.task: Understand the concept of a stack data structure and its LIFO principle.
plan.cheat:
* LIFO (Last-In, First-Out)
* Key operations: push, pop, peek, isEmpty
* Use cases: function call stack, undo/redo functionality

plan.task: Implement a stack using arrays and linked lists in Python.
plan.cheat:
* Array implementation: append() for push, pop() for pop
* Linked list implementation:  create Node class, head pointer, push/pop methods
* Consider edge cases (empty stack)

plan.task: Solve problems involving stack operations and applications like balanced parentheses and reversing a string.
plan.cheat:
* Balanced Parentheses: use a stack to track opening brackets, match with closing brackets
* String Reversal: push characters onto stack, pop and concatenate for reversal
* Consider efficiency of different approaches

plan.task: Review fundamental concepts of probability and linear algebra relevant to ML
plan.cheat:
* Probability distributions (normal, binomial)
* Linear transformations
* Eigenvalues and eigenvectors

plan.task: Deep dive into Regression models (Linear, Polynomial, Ridge, Lasso)
plan.cheat:
* Ordinary Least Squares (OLS)
* Regularization techniques (L1, L2)
* Bias-variance tradeoff

plan.task: Explore Classification algorithms (Logistic Regression, Support Vector Machines)
plan.cheat:
* Logistic function and its properties
* SVM: hyperplanes, kernels (linear, RBF)
* Model evaluation metrics (precision, recall, F1-score)

plan.task: TEST: Practice problems on Regression and Classification
Understand the basics of ensemble methods (Bagging, Boosting)
plan.cheat:
* Random Forest: bagging and feature randomness
* AdaBoost: iterative weighting of misclassified instances
* Gradient Boosting: sequential model fitting

plan.task: Learn about dimensionality reduction techniques (PCA, t-SNE)
plan.cheat:
* Principal Component Analysis (PCA): variance maximization
* t-distributed Stochastic Neighbor Embedding (t-SNE): visualization

plan.task: Revision of all topics covered this week. Focus on weak areas.
Introduction to Data Structures and Algorithms
plan.cheat:
* What is a data structure?
* Basic algorithm concepts
* Time and space complexity (Big O notation - basic understanding)

* Declaration and initialization
* Accessing elements
* Basic array operations (insertion, deletion, searching)

plan.task: Test on Arrays and Basic Concepts
Linked Lists: Introduction and Singly Linked Lists
plan.cheat:
* Nodes and pointers
* Traversal
* Insertion and deletion at the beginning, end, and middle

plan.task: Linked Lists: Doubly Linked Lists and Circular Linked Lists
plan.cheat:
* Doubly linked list structure
* Circular linked list structure
* Advantages and disadvantages of each type

plan.task: Understand the concept of a stack and its LIFO principle.
plan.cheat:
* LIFO (Last-In, First-Out)
* Key operations: push, pop, peek, isEmpty
* Use cases: function calls, undo/redo functionality

plan.task: Implement a stack using an array and a linked list, and analyze their time and space complexities.
plan.cheat:
* Array implementation: push/pop at the end, O(1) time complexity
* Linked list implementation: push/pop at the head, O(1) time complexity
* Space complexity depends on the number of elements
